This is a new restaurant located in the area of the Polk Gulch. Parking was a cinch but watch what street you park your car because this neighborhood can be a little sketchy. 
The food was good and plan on going back as they are open till 2:00am 7 days a week! That's perfect for those night owls out there or people who work late.
The price is a little more than Subway but you can tell by the quality of the ingredients and taste. I can compare them to Ikes as they are equally great.

4 Stars for now as this was my first and not the last.
author: Ben L.

description: I love this place. My husband and I come in all the time. I get the day after thanksgiving and he gets the fire cracker. They are both amazing. The Dutch crunch bread is great.
author: Katelin N.

description: I happened to stumble upon this place and decided to go in for lunch. I ordered the New York sandwich. It was really good and a lot of food. Although a little pricey I will definitely be going back!
author: Stephen -.

description: The kitchen is clean. The dining area is clean. The food is tasty and affordable. What more could you ask for from a sandwich place?
author: Sean M.

description:
I was really surprised by how nice the inside of Eleven O One looked, it had warm-red painted walls covered by paintings and art work. Comfy cushioned-seats along bright windows facing Polk St. There is an upstairs loft for a quieter atmosphere. This place advertises as late-night bar/lounge, but I imagine this would be a perfect artsy cafe! 

Came here for their decently priced lunches: sandwiches, wraps and salad. I got the Nicoise Salad: greens, tuna (the canned kind not the fancy seared Ahi kind), hard broiled egg, green beans and spears of perfectly cooked asparagus. It was drenched in olive oil and balsamic vinegar but by the end of the meal I realized I should've asked for it on the side- WAY too oily and soaked into the greens. 

Still a very delicious salad and very nice service- the guy taught me how to say Nicoise properly!
author: Eva H.

description: Great sandwich spot, open as late or later than Polk St. bars most nights!
author: Patrick P.

description:
Great sandwiches, comfortable place to hang out with a LCD TV and good music. Open til midnight on weekdays and 2AM on weekends.

I recommend the C'est La Vie sandwich it's huge! Easy for two people to split and fill up on.
author: Weston S.

description:
I haven't tried the sandwiches, but the wraps aren't bad.  

I would recommend that Eleven O One provides some sort of side with their sandwiches/wraps.  For the price that you charge, you should take a look at what your competitors are doing.  

Millers, for instance, provides a potato or macaroni salad (along with a dill pickle) with their sandwiches - they're only a few blocks up the street and their food is amazing: http://www.yelp.com/biz/millers-east-coast-deli-san-francisco

La Boulange offers a side salad or fries (or combo both) with their DELICIOUS club: http://www.yelp.com/biz/la-boulange-san-francisco-6

Eleven O One - get with the program and offer a bit more than what you're offering.  Even my wrap was very skimpy on the meat and was mainly stuffed with lettuce (both times that I ordered and both were different wraps!)

One other thing... if you're going to offer soup, try switching it up from the Chicken Noodle that you seem to only offer. THANKS!
author: Noneya B.

description: Much better than the joint it replaced. Select menu with healthy fare food (salads, wraps, soups etc) and sizable portions for a good price. Cucumber infuses ice water which I have to say is a great twist and great classic music playing non stop. Highly recommend if you're into small eats and finger food.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Big sandwiches!! I'm talking Huge. And probably the best in the neighborhood for sandwiches. 

They also have a few good veggie options, which is often hard to find at most sandwich shops. I'm a fan of the tree sitter which is full of veggies and fresh mozzarella and hard boiled eggs.  The service is always great here - they seem really proud of their food and their sandwiches. 

Also, they usually have the game on during the weekend, so it's a good place to grab a beer and a sandwich while catching the game.
author: Smartwater o.

description:
So good!  
IMO there is a dearth of good sandwich shops in san franciso, which shouldn't be the case in this city.  But Eleven O One is definitely one of the bright spots.  My sandwich, the Day after Thanksgiving (you can guess why), was delicious and filling.  I'll definitely be back to try a different of their ~20 sandwich varieties.
Highly recommend.
author: Rob C.

description: This was good. Undecided whether really good. Will need to give it another try. Oh noes, poor us. ;)
author: Heather R.

description: Great sandwiches and great service. A more trendy version of Bite, a staple in the Nob Hill/Tenderloin sandwich world. Highly recommended!
author: Andrey G.

description: Crazy good stuff here, way too many options/opt outs. Just so goooood.
author: Sarah T.

description: Given my previous review and experience here, I never thought I'd come back to this place. Eventually, I had to after a friend wasn't satisfied with the other food options within walking distance, and I figured "everyone deserves a second chance." I'm glad I gave them that chance because now I'm addicted. I'm embarrassed by the amount of times I've been back there, but I just can't help myself. They're sandwiches are so good and there are so many great ones to choose from. Right now, my favorite is the Unholy Matrimony (pulled chicken, mayo, peppercorn ranch sauce, lettuce, and jalepaneo popper).
author: Stephen C.

description: I tried the wraps and they were good but I also ordered the home made fries and they were really bad. My order was a pick-up order and the service was really fast I'll give you that.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Things that stuck out to me (positively): their dutch crunch bread, cucumber water, interesting selection of libations, and seating.

Unfortunately, the sandwiches are pretty plain.  Still, it's a nice addition to my mental list of places to eat that are open late.
author: Jenn C.

description: I'm usually there during lunch, which is great!  But the night staff is awful. Very dismissive. A little rude. I get you want to go home but that shouldn't show. The girl was very dismissive and the guy barely showed interest. I will go to Sliders next time.
author: Abram C.

description: I like how this place is open till 2am (even though I visited at 11pm). The soup was a bit salty, yet tasty. They have a nice variety for late night eats, and a cool upstairs seating area.
author: Ameer N.

description: I love the sandwiches from there, they are big and good, the only problem is that they dont have soft drinks or juices, only beer
author: Jose I.

description: Dude...seriously I've lived in the TL for a year now and I love little Saigon but sometimes a girl just wants a beer, sausage, and some good tunes! Super cute and hilarious service. I came here and two different friends joined me which gave me a chance to sample multiple menu items. The dogs are off the hook, the sammies are crazy real and huge like mom made, and how can I forget their beers! 23 bottles and 3-5 taps and all $3-7 wow...super cool little hang out. Overall great food, beer, atmosphere, and service. I will be here often!!!
author: Kayleen R.

description: C'est la Vie has everything in it.  All I need is half and I share this bad boy.  Nice spot to drop by for an above average sandwich and some cheap draft options.  Bread and ingredients are on the fresher side, but the only drawback is that the prices are close to being not worth it... unless you share.
author: Christopher L.

description: Had the finding nemo salad which was OK, nothing special at all. The salmon tasted like salmon you would get out of a package from Safeway or something, very little fixings. I also had the Nicoise salad and that was good, I liked the tuna in it and it had great asparagus and a really good dressing. However, the 4 star review comes from the Firecracker sandwich. WOW, one of the best sandwiches I have ever had in my life. Salsalito turkey breast, hot sauce, mayo and pepper jack cheese--If you like hot sauce and spice, THIS is the sandwich for you! I got it on wheat bread and I enjoyed every minute of it! YUM, I dream of this sandwich!!!
author: Jennifer J.

description: The place is okay, maybe because I only got a salad. The portions are huge though, so there's that. Updated review to come once I eat something fried...
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Love me some rotisserie chicken and late nite food options. Affordable prices, friendly service and relaxed atmosphere, especially compared to the shady Polk St action outside. Gouda Good is a solid choice when sober, and the Kitchen Sink rocks after many drinks.

Suggested improvements:
- fresher bread (wheat roll tends to by very dry)
- more specialized beer & wine options (lots of standard stuff available)
- bigger/more TVs if they want people to hang out a while, watch sports, and have more drinks

I'll be back often.
author: Jon V.

description: This is a neat little spot on Polk with generally decent prices.  Most of their sandwich and wrap combinations seem quite inventive, but I'd say the result is more flash in the pan than flash on the tongue.  The fact that one third of my wrap was simply wrap was a problem.  The glorious combination of pulled pork and caesar salad components didn't blend beyond bland.  I also acquired some onion rings, which looked better than they tasted mostly because the breading shattered upon impact.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Down the street from my apartment. Anytime I want a sandwich, I go here. It's not cheap but it's definitely worth the price. Draft beer is around $2-3...always good to have a beer with the sandwich. This place is also open late! They have a nice sitting area upstairs. To sum it up, Eleven O One is a good place to have food, drinks, and chill with your friends.
author: Andrew H.

description: This spot is great! Never disappointed. I order the smooth chicken wrap and it is delicious every time. The chicken is so moist and flavorful. The veggies are always fresh. It definitely a good price for the money you spend and service is always great.
author: Ashley C.

description: 1101 is a Great place to grab a healthy bite When In the loin. Their rotisserie chicken in particular is amazing and servings are generous.
author: Maggie V.

description: Frankly it was shocking to get cold food and half cooked still in frozen state dishes, not at all expected from 4 star rated place.
author: Sudip R.

description: I don't understand how it isn't packed all of the time. This is one my favorite places to go in the city for a great sandwich. The employees are consistently friendly and helpful and always make me feel welcome. The seating is nice, clean, and modern with cute loft, although the seating is too small for my legs so I have to squirm around in my seat. This place is a total gem. It's so worth the 8 or 9 dollars for the quality.. and they have a few beers on tap :)
author: Jamie M.

description: I really like this place. The popcorn chicken, and upstairs seating arrangement is a nice change from some of the late night food spots in the area. They serve beer all the way up till bar time and the place is always clean. The staff was super attentive and nice. They even had aloe water in the fridge which I thought was awesome!
author: Kate D.

description:
gobbler gobbler gobbler.

oh yeah and the sangria! great spot on polk, great staff and great sangria ; )
author: Jenny B.

description: This was an ideal find late on a Saturday night when all the bars in the neighborhood seemed overcrowded, and I just wanted a comfy place to sit and sip on a beer and have a snack to match. I love their sandwich menu...the bread is just the right texture and ingredients are fresh with tangy sauces and delicious flavor combos. Their bleu cheese potato bites appetizer also really hit the spot. There are plenty of pillow-backed booths, and the staff is very friendly. Will definitely be back!
author: Kelly W.

description: Great little cafe in the TL. Seems very new. Super nice staff. Sandwiches are a little pricey, but has a good gourmet kick to it. Cool music playing. Seems like a great hangout spot. I'm digging the upstairs loft.
author: Zach L.

description: Because of this place and Bite all sandwiches to me are very small! I tried to eat a sandwich for lunch resently at a different place I was like what? this is small! Love this place and its Tenders! and nothing is better then a Gooda Good with a Sangria!
author: Kev R.

description: Several friends that live in the neighborhood, as well as patrons/bartenders from the Lush Lounge (all on Polk Street) have told me repeatedly that I needed to go to this place as they raved about the food and prices. A buddy and I went earlier this week and had the Tri Tip sandwich and split an order of fries, and the sandwich was moist, tender and succulent and the bread was incredible. The garlic aioli really made the sandwich even better. The only problem with this place is that their chalk board menu offers so many mouth watering tempting sandwiches, it's next to impossible to decide what to pick, as they all are amazingly creative and sound delicious. I'll definitely be back as will my buddy.
author: Timothy L.

description:
I'm in love with Hanks blue bites and the "Gobbler" sandwich. It's no ordinary turkey sandwich packed with bacon and blue cheese.

I used to come here when it was "Hanks", but despite the name change, the menu still includes all my favorites!
author: Lindsay G.

description: Lots of food for the money. Sandwich was ok and fries were plentiful and adequate quality. Service was friendly but seemed like it took an awful long time to get food for an otherwise empty restaurant. Music a bit too loud as it made it impossible to hold a conversation. I'll try someplace different next time.
author: Dave H.

description: I live close by so I come here all the time. Delicious vittles, nice staff, decent beer selection, and comfortable atmosphere. I'm very happy these guys moved in. Shit I think I want a sammich right now.
author: Wayne B.

description:
I love this place. I would say this is the best salad I have ever eaten! The greens are wonderful and dressing is perfect. 

My boyfriend and I have been here about 5 times and I have always gotten the salad - never let down. My boyfriend has gotten something different every time - always gotta be something meaty for him - and always good. 

The atmosphere is great in there too. I really hope this place doesn't go away because it's so small and not in a great location. 

GO HERE!
author: Amy W.

description: Grab yourself "The Kitchen Sink" sandwich with some sweet potato tots and wash it down with a Chimay blue.  You'll feel the euphoria wash over you.  Excellent sandwich, excellent service, excellent tots and a great selection of beers.
author: Corey V.

description: sweet potato fries with the cayenne mayo sauce...woo hoo...enough said.
author: Phil S.

description: Went back a couple days ago. The food was over cooked and lacked flavor. Still a good concept.
author: Michael T.

description: This place is clean, classy and their food is AMAZING. We tried the Cannibus Moment Dog (great!) the Carribean (too salty) and the Love Affair (mmm!). They also serve Framboise- an amazing raspberry lambic beer. The atmosphere is very nice and our waiter was super friendly.
author: Maggie L.

description: Great sangria. The food was just ok. We got hot dogs, but they were kind of hard to eat. The bleu cheese tator tots were good, but a little too much. Want to come back to try the sandwiches though
author: Olivia M.

description: this place has some decent chicken sandwich and salads. The service is great and the prices are reasonable. I eat here at least 3 times a week, and always had a decent meal.
author: Bob b.

description: My friend and I got these delicious sammies the other day. The sandwiches themselves were great, nice thick bread and creative sauces/ingredients. The fries were like two stars though, i hate it when fries aren't soft. I like a place that serves sandwiches AND beer, so I was stoked with my Stella and gouda chicken sandwich. Tip: split! The sandwiches are massive.
author: Cat M.

description: Great food - especially the tater tots and onion rings - anything fried, really. Good service and cheap beer!
author: Machinations F.

description: I came in and left wondering why this place is under the sports bar category when there's nothing bar like about this place, other then the fact that they serve beer and wine, which we all know, does not a bar make. Elven O One isn't a bar but a place to sit down and enjoy some good eats. My friend and I were in the neighborhood to check out some places to celebrate my upcoming birthday. Both of us were hungry so I suggested we stop in. I ordered Hank's Blue Cheese Bites (tater tots drenched in blue cheese goodness) for my friend and I (even though I ended up eating most of them, I feel no shame), a Texas wrap that was oozing barbeque sauce and each jalapeño was more spicy than the first, and a Bitter American all for $17. My friend originally ordered a California Hillbilly wrap but after being informed they were out of pork decided to get a Texan wrap as well. One wrap could easily feed two people but we were both hungry and left our plates practically empty. The guys working behind the counter were friendly and gave good service. The décor was nice but the couches and throw pillows had some wear and tear. Next time I'm bar hopping in the neighborhood and in need of pre drink or after drink(s) food I'll spend my money here rather than sliders and I'll drag whomever I'm out with, with me.
author: Angee R.

description: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!  All of there food is great, very friendly staff, chill music, very fun atmosphere, the list goes on... My twin brother and I go there often, always leaving happy! Go there you'll love it!
author: Kyle M.

description: Delicious sandwiches. Gonna have to try them all now.  Also, cheap beer around the clock.  $3 for a Sierra Nevada?  Yes please.
author: Bradley H.

description: This place is pretty cute for the polk area. I'll probably be back to try the sandwiches.
author: pizzazz g.

description: Love Affair and Watermelon Beer. Great Lunch place with an extensive sandwich/wrap menu and open til the wee hours. My new go-to in The Loin.
author: Brianna G.

description: Um...you had me at hello?  I could order their entire menu in one drunken stupor, die trying to consume it all, and be fully at peace with my final moments here on earth.  I really hope this place doesn't ever leave: If heaven is a fry basket, then Eleven O One is the conduit to eternal life.  Thank you, and Amen.
author: Katrina M.

description: What more can you say? Tasty food, huge portions, reasonable prices for San Francisco, and friendly service.
author: Justin B.

description: Great customer service! I live in the neighborhood and it's hard to find a place like this where everyone always seems like they're genuinely in a good mood every time I come in. The atmosphere is great, there's always tunes playing and everything is clean and aesthetically pleasing. There's a little balcony area to sit in, which is cool--kind of like a VIP lounge. The menu is KILLER. So many good eats-- the sweet potato  fries and spicy dip that comes with 'em, the chicken caesar wrap with tons of awesome meat in it, and my favorite has to be the Day After Thanksgiving sandwich (it is really hard to find a good cran-turkey sandwich in this town)! And my favorite thing about Eleven O One is that they're open LATE! Please go eat/drink/hang here!
author: Amoeba D.

description: It's so great that this place is open late, perfect for grabbing a bite on the way home from a bar.  The sweet potato fries are my favorite, although every sandwich I've tried so far has also been delicious.  The servers are very friendly and the food comes out quickly.
author: Joni G.

description: Ordered over fifty dollars of food - waited two hours - not even the courtesy of a call from the restaurant.  texted grub hub who called back and said that the restaurant contracts with a delivery service that had not picked up my order.  Cancelled and asked that the charge be removed form my credit card.
author: James B.

description: i just moved into the neighborhood and discovered this great sandwich spot.  on the pro-side, it's a block from my apt!  yay.  on neg-side, they only have 2 veggie sandwich options.  the one i got, tho, was super-yummy and the guy working there was really nice and friendly -- that goes a long way in my book!  i'll def be back.  and apparently they have wifi -- a nice spot for lunch and for me to do a little work while kicking back watching the lively streets in good ol' polk gulch.
author: Diane D.

description: love the corndogs.  i'm not a big fan of shredded lettuce on sandwiches though.  always nice when i call in orders for pick up too.
author: Shannon C.

description:
Thought this would be good- the sandwich sounded good - unfortunately I'm covered in hives, and my throat is on fire now, after specifically requesting sauces to not be included, and them adding something else to the sandwich. When a customer requests absolutely no sauce to be on the sandwich- you should listen to the customer- there is probably a good reason, and I asked them if there was more than the sauce listed on the menu, and told him I have food allergies, and the server informed me that there was not - so I assumed I would get a condiment free sandwich. Nope, it was slathered in that sauce, and mustard (which was not listed as one of the items they would put on it)- and after a few bites I noticed their error, and now I am sick. 
 I had the sandwich togo, and got out much too late from work to go get this replaced - I'm really pissed off, because I spent over $13 on food that made me miserable after eating only a few bites. I work in a restaurant too, and if I were to make a mistake like this, I would be fired. Will NOT be returning.
author: Alexis S.

description: my new late night munchie spot, open til 2 am some nights.  food was hot and tasty, fresh cut fries.  the only complaint i could have, would be no salt on the fries.  but i ordered at 130 am, and was met with good customer service when i arrived.
author: mike f.

description: Nicoise salad is awesome, and the wraps are dope. They now have the Gobler and Chicken Gouda sandwiches from the sandwich shop up on Sutter "Byte". Both amazing sandwiches They take pickup orders too, nice people.
author: edgar s.
